newsitem.title: USA: NBA BASKETBALL-SONICS OUTLAST BULLETS IN DOUBLE OVERTIME.
newsitem.headline: NBA BASKETBALL-SONICS OUTLAST BULLETS IN DOUBLE OVERTIME.

text.p: Shawn Kemp scored 34 points and Gary Payton 31 as the Seattle SuperSonics outlasted the Washington Bullets 115-110 in double overtime Wednesday for their ninth straight victory.
Hersey Hawkins had a key steal and Sam Perkins made two free throws with 7.8 seconds left in the second extra session to seal Seattle's 10th victory in 12 games this season.
"We were very tired, we fought hard and we hung on," Seattle coach George Karl said.
"It wasn't very pretty, but it's a road win. I'm just glad we're playing winning basketball, because we're not playing good basketball."
Detlef Schrempf had 23 points and 15 rebounds for Seattle, which has won 14 of its last 15 meetings with the Bullets.
"They made us beat them," Kemp said. "We used our heads and played a simple game in the end. We made some smart decisions down the stretch, but we're still not playing well."
Chris Webber poured in 34 points on 15-of-24 from the field and added 13 rebounds, five assists and seven blocks for the Bullets, who have alternated wins and losses in their last five contests.
"We never gave up and we kept fighting," Juwan Howard said. "We ran out of steam in the end. We couldn't hit the shot."
"The best aspect of this game is that we saw a a lot of heart on the court," Bullets coach Jim Lynam said.
"We were just very tired at the end."

The Bullets trailed 92-76 with 5:18 left in regulation before storming back with a 21-5 run to tie it 97-97 and force ovetime. Chris Whitney made a pair of three-pointers and had seven points and Webber added seven during the run.
Webber scored all 10 Bullets points in the first OT.
"I thought I played a good game, but we came up short in the end," Webber said. "They are a great team."

In Phoenix, Michael Jordan and Scottie Pippen scored 37 points apiece and combined to score the team's first 25 points as the Bulls remained unbeaten by breezing to a 113-99 victory over the winless Phoenix Suns.
Dennis Rodman grabbed 16 rebounds for Chicago, which extended the best start in franchise history to 11-0. The NBA record for most wins to start the season is 15.
Phoenix is off to the worst start in franchise history at 0-10, eclipsing its previous mark set in 1985-86.
In Boston, Grant Hill scored 23 points and Lindsey Hunter added 22 as the Detroit Pistons beat the Celtics 108-83 for their fifth straight win.
The Pistons stopped a five-game losing streak at Boston and are now 5-0 on the road. Detroit (9-1) is off to its best start since beginning the 1970-71 season with a 12-1 record.
Rookie Antoine Walker had 18 points and a season-high nine rebounds for the Celtics.
In Charlotte, Vlade Divac scored 11 of his 23 points in the fourth quarter as the Hornets took advantage of sloppy play down the stretch by the New York Knicks for a 93-86 win.
Ex-Knick Anthony Mason added 20 points for Charlotte, which snapped a four-game losing streak and avenged a loss at New York on November 3.
Patrick Ewing scored 18 points for New York, which lost its first road game of the season and had a three-game winning streak halted.
Larry Johnson, who was dealt to New York in exchange for Mason and Brad Lohaus, had only nine points and three rebounds in 27 minutes in his return to Charlotte.
In Philadelphia, Reggie Miller scored 22 points and Travis Best added 18 as the Indiana Pacers pulled away in the second half for a 103-92 victory over the 76ers.
Indiana, which had lost four of their last five games, was still without centre Rik Smits.
In San Antonio, Loy Vaught had 20 points and eight rebounds to lead the Los Angeles Clippers to a 93-81 victory, over the Spurs.
The Clippers stopped a 12-game losing streak at San Antonio over seven years.
The Spurs again were without starting centre David Robinson and starting forward Charles Smith.
In Vancouver, Tim Hardaway scored 19 points and Isaac Austin added 17 and nine rebounds to lead the Miami Heat to a 94-75 victory over the Grizzlies.
Bryant Reeves had 16 points and 10 rebounds for the Grizzlies, who have lost four straight games.
At Los Angeles, Karl Malone scored a season-high 37 points, 20 in the third quarter, and John Stockton added 16 and 13 assists as the Utah Jazz beat the Lakers 113-97 for their fourth straight win.

Shaquille O'Neal led Los Angeles with 26 points and 13 rebounds and Nick Van Exel added 20 points and 11 rebounds. The loss was the first of the season for the Lakers at home and snapped their three-game winning streak overall.
